Method Detail

buildTree

public void buildTree()
Description copied from interface: IDirectoryTree
Constructs a tree, beginning with the root and recursively creating new nodes for sub-files and directories. This is a depth-first search and runs in its own thread.

delete

private void delete(java.io.File f)
Private helper method. Java only allows the deletion of directories that are empty. This recursive method iterates through the children of any specified folder and deletes all subfiles

Parameters:
f -

delete

public boolean delete(java.lang.String filePath)
Description copied from interface: IDirectoryTree
Deletes the Node with path filePath. Note that this does not ask for confirmation and will shift-delete (i.e permant deletion) files

Parameters:
filePath - The absolute path of the file that is to be deleted
Returns:
true if the node was successfully deleted, false otherwise

retrieveNode

public Node retrieveNode(java.lang.String nodePath)
Description copied from interface: IDirectoryTree
Finds and returns the Node located at nodePath

Parameters:
nodePath - the absolute path to the path of the desired node
Returns:
null if the node was not found in the tree

Private recursive method that does the scanning necessary for building the tree
